intro: Hieracium longiberbe, commonly known as the long-beaked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a long, narrow tube that gives the plant its common name. Hieracium longiberbe is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
